intro: Cordia portoricensis, commonly known as the Puerto Rican cordia, is a small evergreen tree native to the Caribbean island of Puerto Rico. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by animals. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories, contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitat.
